data.title: Very Good Sandwich Place
data.text: I have a good time eating the cuban sandwiches here, which are really close to authentic. The place is very nice and simple. There are some alternative options for sandwiches such as non-pork or vegetarian, which is nice for my friends to have.

data.title: Tried their "old dishes of Cuba" dinner
data.text: We had eaten brunch here years ago and read about their "lost dishes of Cuba" dinners, where they recreate meals from a very old Cuban cookbook. Things did not start well, since nobody really greeted us upon arrival so we sat ourselves. Then the staff asked us to move because another large group was coming that wanted to sit together. Not handled very well. Once the dinner began, we enjoyed the food and wine pairings plus the little history lessons about each dish. Especially enjoyed the orange blossom ice cream made by The Parlour nearby. Although we enjoyed the experience overall, we probably won't be doing another one of these dinners there. Perhaps just pop back in for brunch or lunch sometime.

data.title: Cuba in the Heart of Durham
data.text: By far one of the best Cuban sandwiches I've had outside of Miami -- I'd say Havana but I've never been there. Love to take coworkers there and share the wealth of delicious that this smaller venue contains. Get the plantains -- they're to die for!!!!

data.title: Gloriously delicious fare with wonderful salsa music!
data.text: A wonderful place to meet friends or just relax; food and service are as warm as the Caribbean sun and the flavors and smells reminded me of past delis I've visited in the Northeast.  If you visit or live in Durham, you owe this place a visit.  Cubano cafe' es muy delicioso!

data.title: tasty place, change from the ordinary
data.text: good sandwiches, refreshing ambience.     It's a little porky, for those of us who don't eat pork.  :-)  But I had the Turkey, and it was flavor-ful.

data.title: Cuban Sandwiches to Die for
data.text: This establishment is close to the county offices downtown, so every time I have a training I look forward to eating here. The cuban sandwiches are AUTHENTIC and delicious!

data.title: Love their cuban sandwiches and mojitos!
data.text: Love this place for their sandwiches, black beans & rice, and mojitos. They cued us in on the best rum to use for these drinks. Everything is fresh, delicious, and quick.

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: We had lunch here one day while in Durham.  I had a grilled cheese with added avocado which was pretty good.  Everyone else said what they had was very good.  This is one of those order at the counter, clean up your own restaurants that still has a tip section for you to fill out at while paying at the counter....

data.title: Mouth watering flavors...
data.text: I'm from NYC and I missed the Latin food experience when I first moved to Durham.  However, I discovered the fabulous eatery one day while walking down Main St. and the moment I walked the aroma I'm so accustomed to hit me, then I noticed the atmosphere reminded me of the village in NYC.  It felt like home and when I got my first taste of a Cuban sandwich I was hooked.  Every dish I tried has been delicious and the people who work there are friendly and courteous.  I would have given it a 5 if the servings were more generous.

data.title: Phenomenol
data.text: Some of the best, authentic Cuban food we have had. Delightful and charming local spot with friendly service and very, very tasty sandwiches. Go and enjoy, again and again.

data.title: Real Havana in our City!
data.text: I was raised in Tampa, Florida in the 1950's where Havanans moved in droves and set up their sandwich shops in Ybor City, the Cuban enclave.  Since I moved out of Florida, I had been disappointed in the Cuban cuisine in other cities, including Durham.  Now Durham has a fabulous place for authentic Cuban cuisine and atmosphere!  Old Havana Sandwich Shop is the real deal.  I felt like I was back in Ybor City!  I went for lunch and had their Havana Cuban sandwich and a refreshing homemade pineapple/mint homemade soda.  The bread was fresh and pressed to crunchy perfection.  Inside was the utter essence of Cuban sandwiches -- lots of melt-in-your-mouth moist and chopped roasted pork (local!), subtle melted cheese, the perfect pickles and mojo sauce, a nice slice of a special ham, and lastly, the mustard.  Heaven!  And the soda was just the right light mild sweetness -- almost a mojito, and a great balance to the sandwich.  The atmosphere feels like the streets of old Ybor City -- friendly, down-to-earth, slow and easy.  There's a small group of easy chairs in one section for hanging out and drinking Cuban espresso.  The owner was cooking and greeting when I went in today, and the service was quick and efficient.  They have taken best advantage of the latest Square technology to make order placement at the counter quick and painless.  And their website is fabulous.  You can set up an account and order takeout in great detail, which I plan to do when I don't have time to go enjoy the wonderful atmosphere inside.  This just became my go-to place in Durham!  Additional cool thing -- the owners are also establishing a small farm just outside the city.  And they have a monthly 4-course dinner at the restaurant on one Friday night, which I will review separately.

data.title: Great Vegetarian options!
data.text: Always a favorite of mine whenever I'm in downtown Durham at lunchtime! I love the veggie options and love bringing new customers with me when I visit! I've been a fan since this restaurant opened.

data.title: Nice quaint sandwich place
data.text: At first glance the old havana shop appears to be more ordinary and nothing special. But one taste of the sandwiches and you know there is something special and unique about this place. The food is certainly good, but a bit pricey for what you get. I was,  however, somewhat taken aback but the fact that during my visit, the ice machine wasn't working and the glasses for sweet tea were better for shots than for tea! The tea was not sweet and not all that good either. Oh well... at least the sandwich was tasty.

data.title: Great food
data.text: We finally stopped by here for lunch after meaning to eat here for a long time.  The food did not disappoint.  We split a delicious Havana Sandwich (Classic Cuban) as well as the plantain chips and the croquettas.  Everything was delicious and fresh.  I also tried one of their house made sodas - pineapple mint.  Truly unique and very tasty.  I will definitely be returning to try more of the menu items.

data.title: Really tasty twist on brunch
data.text: Came here for brunch with a friend who grew up in Puerto Rico.  We sat down and tears sprang to her eyes as she was reminded of her grandmother.  The food was great and the coffee was fantastic. I definitely recommend the Maduros and the Cafe cubano. Staff was super friendly as well.

data.title: Another disappointment
data.text: This is not Cuban food, not even close. I have yet to find real Cuban food in the triangle area. It was just ok but lacked the real Latin flavor and spice. Mostly just lots of smoke in your eyes when eating in.

data.title: Cuba a block away from new Durham hotels
data.text: Almost simultaneous with my move downtown five years ago, Old Havana appeared. I generally eat there once a week. Wonderful Cuban sandwiches and I love the Sampler plate. The pork is from local producers and the highest quality. Roberto left Cuba about 15 years ago, and he really knows Cuban food. In fact he led two successive food tours to Cuba early this year

data.title: The name says it all
data.text: This is an awesome restaurant very authentic food, good selection.mgreat staff, it has it all try ordering a few appetizers.

data.title: Convenient
data.text: I visited the Old Havana Sandwich Shop during my visit at Durham. The atmosphere was great. They offer diversity of sandwiches and delicious cuban coffe.

data.title: Something different but left feeling hungry
data.text:
This is a cute little restaurant that seemed to be popular with the hipster lunch crowd.  I am not a pork eater so I had the vegetarian plate. The total for my food was $9.14.  When my plate arrived it had a tiny little salad on it, maybe 1/2 cup of rice, a few beans in a bowl, and maybe 10 plantains (the best part in my opinion). The food was fresh and tasty but I felt like there could've been a little bit more food on the plate for the price. My companions all got some type of pork sandwiches and their sandwiches looked good but plain.  I believe they paid about the same for a sandwich only.  If you are really hungry and on the budget then this probably isn't the place for you. If you want to be hip and try something new and don't care about the prices then you will feel right at home here. 

One last thing, if you are vegetarian, make sure you pay attention to what is and what isn't cooked in lard. I believe the hushpuppies and plantain chips are fried in lard.
